intro: Eriogonum piperi var. longiflorum, commonly known as the long-flowered buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family, characterized by its showy, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has hairy, lance-shaped leaves. It produces small, three-lobed fruits that contain several seeds. This species is valued for its ecological role in supporting pollinators and its ornamental appeal in native plant gardens.
